term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - work of adhesion
term.title: work of adhesion

item.text: The work of adhesion per unit area, w A α β δ, is the work done on the system when two condensed phases α and β, forming an interface of unit area are separated reversibly to form unit areas of each of the αδ- and βδ- interfaces. w A α β δ = γ α δ + γ β δ- γ α , γ α δ and γ β δ are the surface tensions between two bulk phases α, β; α, δ and β, δ respectively. The work of adhesion as defined above, and traditionally used, may be called the work of separation.

item.alttext: w A α β δ = γ α δ + γ β δ- γ α
